Shabana Azmi on Dabba Cartel, rise of OTT, and feminism in cinema. VideoAt the India Today Conclave 2025, Shabana Azmi spoke about her role in Dabba Cartel, emphasising that 'power can be quiet'. Co-creator Shibani Akhtar revealed that the concept was built around the idea of a "Shabana Azmi drug cartel" from the outset. The series presents a compelling narrative of women coming together in solidarity within a crime drama, with Azmi's nuanced and quiet yet powerful performance serving as its anchor. Her portrayal marks a significant thematic shift in Indian storytelling. Jyotika also shared her experience and connection to her character, highlighting how the roles reflect real-life struggles faced by women, as well as themes of feminism and women's emancipation.

Karnataka presents a Halal Budget: BJP jabs Congress over funds for MuslimsThe BJP strongly criticised the Karnataka budget for 2025-26, accusing the Congress of appeasing Muslims with Rs 1,000 crore for minorities, Waqf protection, Urdu schools, and 4 per cent contract reservations under Category-II B.

In Cabinet meeting, Trump draws the Lakshman Rekha for MuskIn a Cabinet meeting on March 6, US President Donald Trump drew the line for Elon Musk and his DOGE. He made it clear that Musk and DOGE had just an advisory role and didn't have the final say in hirings and firings. Trump's hard talk came after concerns over voter backlash to mass firings in the federal government.

When fire and poison stalled Hindi's march to Tamil NaduIn 1965, when Hindi was to become India's official language, Tamil Nadu (then Madras State) saw fiery protests that are said to have claimed 150 lives. Many Tamils set themselves on fire and consumed pesticides, thus forcing then-PM Lal Bahadur Shastri to roll back the language decision 60 years ago.

What happened in India and New Zealand's only meeting in the final? Champions Trophy: In their only meeting in the final of the tournament back in 2000, Chris Cairns' 102 not out overshadowed Sourav Ganguly's 117 as New Zealand beat India by four wickets in Nairobi.

Bear with the bullies: Is criticism of India fair or case of sour grapes?India's dominance in cricket sparks controversy as critics question the fairness of the side playing all their Champions Trophy fixtures in Dubai and not the original venue in Pakistan. India face off against New Zealand in the Champions Trophy final on March 9.

Suryakumar defends Rohit amid 'captaincy' row: Led us to 4 ICC FinalsSuryakumar Yadav defended Rohit Sharma against criticism, highlighting his leadership in guiding India to four ICC finals. He reminded of Rohit leading India to the 2024 T20 World Cup triumph, as the team gears up for the Champions Trophy final against New Zealand.

England Cricket Board issues apology for 'ill-judged' Pope Francis jokeThe England and Wales Cricket Board faced backlash after joking about Pope Francis "loving the Ashes" in response to his Ash Wednesday message. The post was deleted, and ECB issued an apology for the insensitivity.

IND vs NZ: Virat Kohli's calmness gives Gautam Gambhir's India its ODI identityIn an era when every team needs to have an 'identity', India's ODI team under Gautam Gambhir is deriving its spirit from the calmness of Virat Kohli. The star batter has been in sensational form for India in the Champions Trophy.

UP Warriorz all but knocked out as Matthews, Kerr power MI to 6-wicket winHayley Matthews smashed a 46-ball 68, while Amelia Kerr registered her best figures of 5/38 as Mumbai Indians stormed to a six-wicket win over UP Warriorz in the Women's Premier League.

Mitchell Santner banking on form ahead of final, says extra travel part of jobNew Zealand skipper Mitchell Santner said that he was banking on his team's form ahead of the Champions Trophy final against India. New Zealand beat South Africa in a high-scoring contest to reach the summit clash.

Champions Trophy 2025 Final: ICC announces umpiring line-upPaul Reiffel and Richard Illingworth, two of the most respected names amongst the umpires are set to officiate the Champions Trophy Final between India and New Zealand on Sunday, March 9.

Champions Trophy: Team flops. Did Pakistan fare better as hosts?Pakistan are not playing the final of an ICC tournament, that they hosted after much drama. While their cricket team has been a failure, how did Pakistan do as the hosts of the Champions Trophy 2025?

Sunil Chhetri comes out of international retirement, to play in FIFA's March windowSunil Chhetri has performed a retirement U-turn as he will be back in India colours during the March international window, AIFF announced on March 6. Chhetri retired from football in 2024.

Ben Stokes as England white-ball captain? Rob Key says 'nothing's off the table'England's managing director of men's cricket Rob Key has hinted that Ben Stokes could be an option to be the new white-ball captain after their exit from the Champions Trophy. Jos Buttler stepped down from his role as captain following their exit from the tournament.

Shreyas ready to be India's X-factor in Champions Trophy final vs New ZealandWith an impeccable record against New Zealand in ODIs, Shreyas Iyer is all set to be India's X-factor in the final of the Champions Trophy on March 9. Shreyas goes up a gear against the Blackcaps when it comes to ICC events, as he has shown in the recent past.

Saud Shakeel oversleeps? 'Timed-Out' in Pakistan's President's Trophy FinalSaud Shakeel was dismissed in the oddest of manners in the President's Trophy in Pakistan. Shakeel was timed out after allegedly oversleeping in the dressing room.

India not at 100 percent despite reaching Champions Trophy final: Sunil GavaskarSunil Gavaskar feels that India are still not operating at their full potential despite reaching the final of the Champions Trophy 2025. India will face New Zealand in the summit clash on March 9 in Dubai.

No one should take New Zealand for granted in final against India: Sunil GavaskarSunil Gavaskar has claimed that no one should be taking New Zealand for granted in the Champions Trophy final clash against India on March 9. Gavaskar feels that the clash on Sunday will be different from their previous clash during the Group stages.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
